info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Swain and northeastern Graham Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Bryson City, or near Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryson City, Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain and B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
